metadata.title: CVE-2018-1999011 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: FFmpeg before commit 2b46ebdbff1d8dec7a3d8ea280a612b91a582869 contains aBuffer Overflow vulnerability in asf_o format demuxer that can result inheap-buffer-overflow that may result in remote code execution. This attackappears to be exploitable via specially crafted ASF file that has to beprovided as input to FFmpeg. This vulnerability appears to have been fixedin 2b46ebdbff1d8dec7a3d8ea280a612b91a582869 and later.

criterions.comment: chromium-browser: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
oxide-qt: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
gst-libav1.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
